channel.title: yudel tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from yudel.

item.description: The right of Christian clergy to massacre Jews is deeply rooted in history. https://t.co/Zo8vysQyW7
President refused to be caught up in the Sunni-Shiite War. Good for him! https://t.co/rvTpRoI4SQ
@MattFriedmanNJ Anyway, aren’t we supposed to be paying premium prices for the legal stuff to ensure a modicum of purity?
Your occasional reminder that Jersey offers better vistas than does Pennsylvania. https://t.co/y1Eik4F7sq
@MattFriedmanNJ Didn’t see it either. I think such figures, if true, would be deeply dispiriting for Big Chlorophyll.

@brettglass @davewiner The other secret of Twitter is to have a list that is your Karass. I follow a couple thousand people -- all generally interesting. I have fewer than a hundred on my list, all people who I want to stay connected with it and whose ideas I don't want to miss.
@brettglass @davewiner Some are peers; some are people who swim in bigger ponds. And always, always, chronological.
@ReallyAmerican1 And vice versa. Fanatics propped up by shady interests.

@kampeas @rmneiss I’m seeing them now. It might be a delay in accessing jpgs — another account I follow is complaining her screen caps are going missing right now.
@kampeas @rmneiss I wouldn’t be surprised if today was a particularly high usage day here in twitterland.
@eevee @swordsjew Vote cause why not? But donate to the party establishment? Never.

@rmneiss Did you delete most of this thread, or has the twitter ai decided that you are doxing Worf’s stepfather?
@rmneiss https://t.co/ygP9UGA0pY
“And Sullivan” That’s the one the oligarchs really hunger for. https://t.co/Iat6bIukrG
@EladNehorai I do hope someone names a dirigible after Schumer.

@OccamShaveCream @emptywheel The Times is a business, not a non-profit organization. It depends on Republicans to advertise in it and, likely in the medium term future, not close it down. That’s why it is devoted to not offending Republicans with loud proclamations of the truth of sho they are.
@OccamShaveCream @emptywheel What duty? She makes her employers very happy.
@OccamShaveCream @emptywheel Why assume negligence rather than deliberate malpractice?
@EladNehorai To think it all comes down to whether my junior senator picked up enough Chabad mind tricks at Oxford to convince turncoat “moderates” to end the filibuster.
@jnack Really can’t wait to get my hands on this for book cover design.
@gabrielmalor Looking forward to the Marshal executing the leaker, as is his wont.

@EbWatchesTrek Can we talk about the fact that in The Cage, the library computer uses a printer for output?
@EbWatchesTrek Also: Ignore the official advice to rewatch The Menagerie and rewatch The Cage instead.
@DeanObeidallah https://t.co/VnIeDEqTLm
@Noleli https://t.co/LNtBIhl6K8
@sargoth https://t.co/QsiyAllwri

@Shmarya @avitalrachel When he ascended, it was reported that became a lawyer to fight the one person one vote Supreme Court rulings of the 60s. I remember that because my great uncle, a lawyer, helped win the Georgia case.
@MalyndaHale @shoshkabob Because we have a Second Amendment to protect our rights from unelected tyrants.
